result.execSummary:
The defendant Mitchell Raymond Crowe was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Battery [Modifiers: Domestic Abuse Assessments], a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 940.19(1).
  • Disorderly Conduct [Modifiers: Domestic Abuse Assessments], a class B misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 947.01(1).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: *Pay all applicable costs, assessments and surcharges, including the DV and DNA surcharges from bail on deposit.  If there is no posted bail the defendant is to pay the costs and surcharges within one year of today's date, failure to pay the costs and surcharges will result in a civil judgment.

Consecutive to: To each other but concurrent to the sentence defendant is currently serving,  with Huber/release privileges if working, 111 days credit.
*The court will allow the sentences to be transferred to Dane County.
*Court advises the defendant he may not possess a firearm and is to provide a DNA sample.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Mitchell Raymond Crowe

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt: See CCAP financial payment plan application for specific monthly due dates for this UTPPP.
Granting request for modification of payment plan.  Defendant to pay $25.00 per month commencing January 1, 2017 until paid.  Copy sent to Defendant.
Per Order of the Presiding Judge, Misdemeanor Division, this request/motion is hereby assigned to the Hon. Jeffrey A. Kremers, Br. 36, for review. spc
Letter from defendant requesting payment plan.
Added that sentence can be transferred to Dane County.

Defendant Mitchell Raymond Crowe in court with attorney Daniel E Meylink.  Defendant Mitchell Raymond Crowe in custody.  Patrick D. Winter appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
cab
As to count 1:
Defendant was advised of constitutional rights and maximum penalties, waived all rights, and plead NO CONTEST.  Defendant examined as to the plea.  Plea Questionnaire/Waiver of Rights and Addendum received and filed.  Stipulation by parties to complaint as a factual basis to sustain the plea.  Court found the defendant guilty. Judgment of conviction entered.
As to count 3:
  Defendant was advised of constitutional rights and maximum penalties, waived all rights, and plead GUILTY.  Defendant examined as to the plea.  Plea Questionnaire/Waiver of Rights and Addendum received and filed.  Stipulation by parties to complaint as a factual basis to sustain the plea.  Court found the defendant guilty. Judgment of conviction entered.
As to count 2:
On motion of the state and pursuant to negotiations, court ordered count 2 dismissed and read-in for sentencing purposes.
Also, pursuant to negotiations, court ordered the "repeater enhancer" on both counts 1 and 3 dismissed.
.
Sentencing continued...
.
As to count 1:
  Sentencing proceeds.    Upon inquiry of the Court, State advises they have complied with victim notification. Statements by counsel and defendant.  

COURT ORDERS defendant to serve 9 months at the House of Correction, consecutive to each other but concurrent to the sentence defendant is currently serving,  with Huber/release privileges if working, 111 days credit.
Defendant to pay all applicable costs, assessments and surcharges, including the DV and DNA surcharges from bail on deposit.  If there is no posted bail the defendant is to pay the costs and surcharges within one year of today's date, failure to pay the costs and surcharges will result in a civil judgment.
Court advises the defendant he may not possess a firearm and is to provide a DNA sample.  
Appeal rights given.  Notice of Right to Seek Postconviction Relief, Pretrial Incarceration Credit.

As to count 3:
  Sentencing proceeds.    Upon inquiry of the Court, State advises they have complied with victim notification. Statements by counsel and defendant.  

COURT ORDERS defendant to serve 1 month at the House of Correction, consecutive but concurrent to the sentence the defendant is currently serving,  with Huber/release privileges if working, -0- days credit.
Defendant to pay all applicable costs, assessments and surcharges, including the DV and DNA surcharges from bail on deposit.  If there is no posted bail the defendant is to pay the costs and surcharges within one year of today's date, failure to pay the costs and surcharges will result in a civil judgment.
Court advises the defendant he may not possess a firearm and  is to provide a DNA sample.  
Appeal rights given.  Notice of Right to Seek Postconviction Relief, Pretrial Incarceration Credit.

The court will allow the sentences to be transferred to Dane County.

Attorney Daniel E Meylink in court, defendant Mitchell Raymond Crowe not in court, in custody.  Elizabeth Longo appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Case in court for plea and sentencing however, the defendant was not produced. Case adjourned to Branch 36.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for November 17, 2015 at 08:30 am.

Attorney Daniel E Meylink in court, defendant Mitchell Raymond Crowe not in court, in custody.  Patrick D. Winter appeared for the State of Wisconsin.

Jury trial date vacated.
  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for November 4, 2015 at 08:30 am.

Received and filed:
Writ of Habeas Corpus ad Prosequendum.
Defendant is in Federal custody.  Court ordered warrant withdrawn.

Attorney Daniel E Meylink in court, defendant Mitchell Raymond Crowe not in court, in custody.  Benjamin Lindsay appeared for the State of Wisconsin.

Case adjourned for a final pretrial and jury trial date in Branch 36.
  Final pre-trial scheduled for October 13, 2015 at 08:30 am.  Jury trial scheduled for November 4, 2015 at 08:30 am.

Attorney Daniel E Meylink in court, defendant Mitchell Raymond Crowe not in court, in custody.  William T. Berens appeared for the State of Wisconsin.

The state is requesting that the court schedule a status date in September after the defendant's revocation hearing.
Case adjourned for a status date in Branch 36.
  Status conference scheduled for September 11, 2015 at 08:30 am.

Attorney Daniel E Meylink in court, defendant Mitchell Raymond Crowe not in court, in custody.  Benjamin Lindsay appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Case in court for pre-trial conference. Defendant is in custody on a felony matter.  Court will keep that warrant active. Defense requested a status date due to the federal matter. Case adjourned to Branch 36.  Status conference scheduled for August 21, 2015 at 08:30 am.
COURT ORDERED DEFENDANT REMANDED TO THE COMMISSIONER ON RETURN OF THE ARREST WARRANT.

Defendant Mitchell Raymond Crowe not in court.  Jesica Ballenger appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Court issued a warrant for failure to comply with order to report to the jail for booking process before 3:00 pm on 7/29/15.

DEFENDANT WAS ORDERED BY THE COURT TO REPORT TO THE MILWAUKEE COUNTY JAIL (CJF) TO BE BOOKED AND RELEASED BY 3:00 P.M. ON  7/29/15. IF THEY FAIL TO APPEAR A BENCH WARRANT WILL BE ISSUED FOR THEIR ARREST.

Signed and filed, No Contact Order.  Defendant to have no contact with CR (DOB 1/13/80), BR (DOB 12/13/58) and KR (DOB 4/11/59).
Court advised defendant that failure to comply with conditions of bail may result in an additional charge of bail jumping.
Court ordered arrest warrant withdrawn.  Recall issued.

Defendant Mitchell Raymond Crowe in court.  Jesica Ballenger appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Defendant advised that this case is assigned to Judge Grady, Branch 37.
Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause.   Defendant received a copy of the complaint and was advised of right to counsel and maximum penalties.  Court entered a plea of not guilty on behalf of the Defendant. Court reserves Defendant's right to file a substitution of judge pursuant to Sec. 971.20 until Defendant's next scheduled court appearance.  Defendant IS Public Defender eligible.  Defendant is ordered to provide the public defender's office with the next court date.  The case is adjourned to Br. 37  for a Pretrial Conference.
As of August 1, 2015 case be reassigned to Judge Kremers, Branch 36.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for August 10, 2015 at 01:30 pm.
